attributes.action: Remove standardised testing from schools in the U.K.
attributes.background: I believe strongly in the fact that every child is different and deserves to be tested as an individual not as a collective group. Tests are not suitable for every child.
attributes.additional_details: As Frederick J. Kelly, the man who invented standardised testing, once said “These tests are too crude to be used and should be abandoned.” Every child is different which is what they are told throughout school, but when it comes to it every child is tested in the same way, not taking into consideration their abilities and strengths. Tests put a lot of unnecessary pressure on both schools and students.

attributes.action: Stop use of ‘no study’ status as part of ‘Immigration Bail’ for migrant children
attributes.background:
The Immigration Bail status took effect in January 2018 & replaces other kinds of status & which may prevent vulnerable migrant children & care leavers accessing education

This is an abuse of human rights & contrary to Acts relating to welfare, protection & safeguarding of children
attributes.additional_details:
Already bail with a no study condition is being enforced without proper examination of circumstances and the impact. 

Not only is it wrong from a moral viewpoint but it is also a real concern to disenfranchise a group of already troubled and damaged young people from society, and leaving them open to abuse from gangs, extremism and other exploitation.

Imagine your 16 year old son arriving abroad after years of traumatic travel without language, a carer, money and cultural knowledge.

attributes.action: Codify the requirement for parliamentary authorisation of military action.
attributes.background: Since 2003, and Parliament's decision to vote in favour of military intervention in Iraq, it has become an accepted convention that Parliament will authorise military action in which British Forces will participate.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst military action is often justified and neccessary, it should not be in the power of PM to unilaterally decide when and where to deploy British Forces. Since 2003, convention has been followed by succesive governments that Parliament should be consulted on military action, it appears that this convention will now be ignored. It is therefore neccessary that this requirement is enforced via statute. Such a statute could include exceptional circumstances whereby action could be expedited.

attributes.action: Amend the Gender Recognition Act 2004 to remove the need for a medical diagnosis
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, urge the government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain to remove any requirement for a diagnosis of gender dysphoria (as endorsed by a psychiatrist or medical practitioner) to receive a gender recognition certificate under the Gender Recognition Act of 2004.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the GRA04 requires a psychiatrist or medical practitioner to diagnose someone with gender dysphoria in order to gain a gender recognition certificate. This is wrong because:

1) Not all transgender people experience dysphoia.
2) There are often considerable waits to see a psychologist or medical practitioner about gender issues, and so this delays the whole process.
3) Seeing someone about gender issues is often invasive, or otherwise uncomfortable.

attributes.action: Please give every child in England the opportunity to study Classics.
attributes.background: Threatened by govt funding cuts and a reputation of elitism & irrelevance, the study of Classics in state schools is in peril.Yet, it continues to be taught in most private schools-for good reason. Classics explores what is eternal about humanity. It teaches us to think & debate. Skills we all need.
attributes.additional_details: Classical ideals of wisdom & virtue formed the foundations of our education system. Increasingly however, we have adopted a more utilitarian approach to the education of the majority: where the focus is the creation of individuals whose labours can best serve the economy.The type of education system we create, determines the type of society we create. A stressful, competitive system that focuses on preparing students to be valuable to an economy, does not nurture the healthiest individuals - nor the healthiest societies.

attributes.action: If a parent refuses child visitation then maintenance should be non-payable
attributes.background: When a couple separate and the resident-parent still with the children refuses any visitation, then the other non-resident parent should not be held accountable for high child maintenance payments when they want to see the children.
attributes.additional_details: Even if they haven’t got any money, the non-resident parent is still hounded to pay without any visitation rights. The stress caused by these situations is at times unbearable yet any non-paying parent is often seen as a bad parent when that’s not the actual case.

attributes.action: Include an engine noise emissions measurement in the MOT of motor vehicles.
attributes.background: Engine noise of some vehicles, particularly motor bikes, has reached offensive levels.

attributes.action: Make AED Defibrillators available more publicly (at least every second street).
attributes.background: AED Defibrillators are a crucial part of basic first aid. Cardiac arrest involves a person being on the verge of dying. Cardiopulmonary Resusictation (CPR) is effective but AED defibrillators may double the chance of a person surviving. This could potentially save your or a loved one life.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Heart Foundation, 100,000 people die from sudden cardiac arrest each year. Without treatment, 95% of the time a cardiac arrest results in death. Having a defibrillator in close proximity is vital, as 80% of cardiac arrests occur at home, with every minute of it being untreated the chance of survival falls by 9%. Having a defibrillator in every street or two, and making neighbors aware of it saves valuable time in treatment and thousands of lives!
Sign up to Save!

attributes.action: Introduce renewable temporary stay for anyone who has been in UK for 14 years
attributes.background: The previous immigration law allows anyone who has been in the UK for 14years to be eligible for permanent residence. However, this was removed in 2010 with government view to removing all overstayers even if they have been in the UK for more than 14years.
attributes.additional_details:
However, recent government reports showed there have been no changes to the number of people deported who have been in the UK for 14years or more as these sets of people are either already have a settled family.

In the light of the above, the government should introduce legal renewable temporary stay for anyone who has been in the UK for more than 14 years without a criminal record so that these sets of people will be able to work legally, contribute to the UK economy positively and pay taxes.

attributes.action: Stop assessing higher education students on their parental income!
attributes.background: As a student In a living in a city, being able to survive on student finance is challenging. Like most students the money I have to survive on is assessed by parental income, not taking into account mortgages and other bills to pay.
attributes.additional_details:
Many students I've spoken to are in a similar situation, Their parents would love to help them out with an additional £3-£4k per year but financially aren't in this position. Thus meaning they are unable to support us as student finance believes they should/could.

Due to the lack of student finance for our future workforce, we are forced into overdrafts before leaving education.

attributes.action: Re-introduce a rail network along the old Wyre Forest / Tenbury line
attributes.background:
Instead of investing millions in making it quicker to get to London rural communities need better financial support to get to other cities. 
In areas such as Tenbury/Cleobury/Bewdley the public transport network does but support the ambitions of the community and prevents commuting and studying.

attributes.action: New law on the ratio of qualified staff/carers to patients in nursing homes
attributes.background: My father was neglected in a care home. There is no minimum legal ratio or a requirement on public or private care facilities to employ a minimum number of staff. I have spent 5 years speaking, researching and gleaning information on this matter.
attributes.additional_details: I had to employ the services of my local MP who contacted The Care Quality Commission on my behalf. I should have been listened to immediately and my concerns taken seriously without having to involve my MP. I have spoken with many carers/qualified nursing staff in nursing homes and in the community, and they believe, that there is neglect is because there is no legal ratio requirement.

attributes.action: Government to take the European Commission to the ECJ for misconstruing Art 50.
attributes.background: In Article 50 of the Treaty of Lisbon there is no mention of monetary reparation for leaving, continual jurisdiction of the European Court of Justice, continual rights of European citizens in the departing territory, or soft annexation of its sovereign territory
attributes.additional_details: Mr Juncker and Mr Barnier seem to want to penalise the UK because of Brexit. But the Treaty of Lisbon makes no particular obligations on leaving countries. If the Treaty envisaged continual supremacy of the ECJ over national courts after departure, or continual freedom of movement for European citizens in the departing country after departure it should have been a treaty provision rather than implied by latter day negotiators.

attributes.action: Introduce a Licencing system for cyclists and tighten up cycle law.
attributes.background:
Recently a facebook post caused horror and cyclists regularly show little regard for other road users and the law.

Please debate introducing a licence, at least with theory tests similar to other vehicles, which all cyclists must pass and must carry at all times and have 3rd party insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
I once received verbal abuse from a cyclist feeling I was in the wrong. I had dash cam footage reviewed by the police who were horrified how many highway code points the cyclist broke. The cyclist could not be traced so no action was taken but it's typical of the lack of knowledge of cyclists.

I am a horse rider, cyclist, motorcyclist, and car driver. The group I see least consideration for road users and frequent law breaking is cyclists.

attributes.action: Make housing associations subject to the freedom of information act.
attributes.background: I pay a service charge for property maintenance on my shared ownership property which is owned by a housing association. This service is contracted out to 3rd party. I recently asked for information relating to this arrangement and have been refused on the grounds that it is commercially sensitive.
attributes.additional_details: Bringing housing associations in line with the FOI act would mean that any requests for information relating to services that the residents wholly pay for, could not be refused outright and would be subject to intervention from the ICO.  This would enable more than 200,000 people to easily access information about their homes that they own in partnership with housing associations and therefore have more say in the running and the maintenance expenditure of their homes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park across/block a private driveway
attributes.background: It seems a large oversight that people have free will to deny people the use of their own driveways by parking across with no repercussions. I myself have had multiple incidents and I’m sure many other people have also and no legal right to get the car moved. I hope to get this changed.

attributes.action: Increase the 5p charge for plastic bags to 10p across the UK
attributes.background: It takes up to 1000 years for a plastic bag to decompose in landfills. Over 100 million marine animals die each year due to plastic in the oceans and other water systems. The 5p bag charge reduced plastic bag usuage by 85% but 2.1 billion bags were still sold between April 2016 and April 2017.

attributes.action: Reform Private Member's Bill procedure so that an objection needs to be seconded
attributes.background: Evidenced today; Friday 15th June 2018, a Private Members Bill was objected to by a lone MP. The Private Members Bill process allows for Bills to be introduced by MPs and Lords who are not government ministers, furthering the democratic process. The objection by one MP hinders that process.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that parliamentary procedures be modernised. When an opportunity arises where an MP may object to a reading of a Private Bill or Private Member Bill, any objection must be seconded by another MP for it to be recognised. This change will allow for the democratic process to represent the electorate without it being compromised by a lone voice.

attributes.action: Provide training to all NHS GP's and Health Visitors on the baby and child sleep
attributes.background: To provide all NHS GP's and Health visitors with an accurate basic knowledge on baby and child sleep. Sleep deprivation is one of the biggest causes of mental health problems in parents and the advice given is very mixed, inaccurate and could cause families more harm.
attributes.additional_details:
GP's and Health Visitors all seem to have different ideas on baby and child sleep. This ranges from:
How much sleep they should have,
When they should wake from their last nap,
Starting solids to get babies to sleep,
Using Piriton (drugging them),
Letting them cry themselves to sleep,
Assuming all babies and children will just fall asleep when they are tired,
Cutting naps from already sleep deprived infants,
Yes, I have heard all of these. Science and research needs to be taken into account now.

attributes.action: Allow postgraduate students the right to financial support for childcare.
attributes.background: Postgraduate students are not classed as eligible for working tax credits, nor are they recognized as students due to not being in receipt of a student loan. This excludes parents from receiving financial support for childcare that is afforded to working parents or undergraduate parents.
attributes.additional_details: Discrimination of parents wishing to complete postgraduate study means they are financially excluded from completing positions which, if afforded support for childcare costs, they would be able to complete. Following postgraduate study, when in employment they would pay a higher rate of tax and would contribute more to the repayment of undergraduate loans. As it stands parents of young children are financially  better off remaining on income support than pursuing funded postgraduate positions.

attributes.action: Ban snares because animals suffer terrible injuries and deaths
attributes.background: Snares are compared to landmines for the indiscriminate way in which these wire traps capture a wide range of animals – from foxes to family pets to protected species. A snare is an archaic thin metal wire noose intended to catch animals by lassoing and trapping them.
attributes.additional_details:
Snares are mainly set on shooting estates to stop foxes from catching the 'game' birds. Britain is one of the few European countries where so-called free-running snares are still used and most countries have banned them. 
The Government believes that snare use can be controlled by a Code of Practice - but this is impossibly to enforce! 
One council has banned snares to protect British wildlife - https://www.league.org.uk/news/council-bans-snares-to-protect-british-wildlife.

attributes.action: Fund baby hatches to allow newborns to be left safely and anonymously
attributes.background:
There have been several cases of newborn babies being abandoned. Most recently and sadly was the case of baby Pearl in Rochdale, Manchester who was found dead in the woods. 
Many countries have baby hatches to allow babies to be abandoned safely, where they can receive immediate attention.
attributes.additional_details:
Belgium, Germany and Canada have introduced baby hatches where a parent can abandon their newborn baby anonymously. This means that despite this desperate act, the infant is safe and warm and an alert is generated so that someone arrives to care for the child straight away. 
This is scheme is needed in the UK to ensure that these parents have a safe space to leave their child and do not have to resort to leaving the infant at risk.

attributes.action: Make sure that there are recycling bins in the classrooms of every school.
attributes.background: As a student, everyday I see a shocking amount of paper go to landfill. I understand that in the current environmental climate, we should be doing all we can to create minimal waste. By ensuring there are recycling bins in every classroom teachers and students could be compelled to act.
attributes.additional_details: Every day students are using worksheets and paper in lesson, however, instead of putting used paper in a recycling bin it is put in the normal bins to go to landfill. I find this shocking, I myself believe that recycling is such an easy way to prevent waste going to landfill sites. There is an easy way to combat this problem, by ensuring every classroom in every school across the country has a recycling bin, many more teachers and students could be compelled to recycle their paper.

attributes.action: Temporary blue badges to be available for those who are incapacitated short term
attributes.background: In 2016 I had foot surgery, I was in plaster cast, followed by a surgical boot. During this time when I was taken to the shops, I was actually more incapacitated than a lot of those who were able to use the disabled parking spaces.
attributes.additional_details: I have contacted West Sussex County Council and my MP in relation to this matter to be told basically that the Blue Badge legislation only currently allows badges to be issued to people with permanent conditions and has a severe impact on their ability to walk and funding.

attributes.action: To stop companies selling debts to debt collection companies
attributes.background: Want it so companies eg mobile phone companies can’t sell a debt on to debt companies who then add extortionate charges and use heavy handed tactics. The contract is between the company and the person who takes out the contract, making that contract a legal document.

attributes.action: Compulsory mental health education in school.
attributes.background: We need to promote good mental health practices in the same way we promote good physical health.

attributes.action: Make Single File riding compulsory for cyclists.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, respectfully call on the Transport Minister to implement Compulsory Single File for all cyclists who ride in groups,  regardless of whether a bike lane exists or not..
attributes.additional_details:
We are tired of seeing cyclists continue to ride two or more abreast, spilling into traffic and impeding traffic flow.

We are tired of the safety hazards such cyclists present. We believe no other safety initiative will deliver better results than compelling cyclists to ride Single File.  indeed, every text book on the subject of Risk Management says that “isolating a hazard” is a superior solution to changing the way people operate. A bike lane is an example of “Isolating the Hazard”.

attributes.action: Abolish the Palace of Westminster restaurant subsidy for those earning over £23K
attributes.background: In 2016, the food/drink subsidy in Parliament cost around £3.7M. This use of taxpayers’ money must stop for higher earners, with funds diverted to public services where it is needed. Citizens who themselves struggle to buy food should not be forced to help feed MPs who earn significant wages.

attributes.action: Minimum of 10 years for causing death by careless or dangerous driving
attributes.background: Too many people are being killed by drivers being drunk, on drugs or using mobile phones will driving.

attributes.action: Change the methods the Government use to record Homelessness
attributes.background: The methods currently used by the Government to record Homelessness portray unrealistic results. Many people are concealed in the 'hidden homelessness' category as they sofa surf or move around on the streets. Current figures are an underestimate, many are not included in the official statistics.
attributes.additional_details: Many people who the average citizen would classify as homeless are neglected from the record as they do not fit Government criteria. We cannot ignore the lives of individuals simply because they are not "lying down in the street" and instead are hiding in the crevice of a doorway. If the Government change the way they record homelessness to give a more representative statistic, as a united country we can tackle this issue with full knowledge of what we are facing.

attributes.action: Issue an official apology to Lauren Southern for denial of entry into the UK
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern was detained in Calais by Kent police and charged under section 7 of the terrorism act, before being denied entry into the UK.

The Government must apologise for this.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that that section 7 was wrongfully applied as Section 41 states that "A constable may arrest without a warrant a person whom he reasonably suspects to be a terrorist." I do not believe that the police believed Lauren Southern to be a terrorist.

attributes.action: Create a voluntary, opt-in, monthly payment that goes 100% to the NHS
attributes.background: Recently, my 2 year old daughter has been suffering from a health condition that we are still looking into. Without the NHS, the treatment my daughter has received and is still yet to receive would have cost me tens of thousands of pounds that I simply could not afford. We all depend on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the taxes we pay are used to fund numerous different categories including international services, culture and religion to name a few as well as the NHS. All of this information can be found on the .gov website. This proposal would be an additional, voluntary payment that would go solely to fund the NHS.
 
As members of the public, we are quick enough to comment that the NHS needs more funding and investment, this option would put the ball in our court. Something needs to change.

attributes.action: Ban the Nazi salute in the UK
attributes.background: The Nazi salute is an insult to those who fought and died for peace during World War Two. Therefore it should be banned in the UK because it offends the Jewish community.

attributes.action: Give English constituencies a referendum on creating an English Parliament
attributes.background: Voters in English constituencies want the creation of a secular single chamber English Parliament elected separately from Westminster and located outside of London. This will address the democratic deficit experienced by English voters and give us English votes for English laws.

attributes.action: A commemorative plaque for the contributions made by the Windrush Generation.
attributes.background: As a result of the recent  negative treatment of the Windrush Generation,   we should instead  acknowledge their invaluable contributions to the successes of British life over the years.

attributes.action: Abolish inheritance tax
attributes.background:
It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed
We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all drivers and bikers to have an onboard camera
attributes.background: My husband was killed in May 2017 while he was doing 15mph on his motorbike. We have never had answers as to what happened that day. There we're 3 other vehicles involved and all statements were different. I feel if they had cameras we would have answers.

attributes.action: Make banks directly responsible for contacting those who have been missold PPI
attributes.background: Banks and credit card companies place the onus on individuals to seek out whether they have had PPI, yet they hold this information and it is readily available to them.  The responsibility should rest with the companies who have missold to make all efforts to trace their victims and make recompense.
attributes.additional_details: Banks hold the information in their systems and files as to who had PPI.  Those most likely to need the compensation are possibly least able to pursue a claim.  Why should individuals have to possibly employ companies who gain financially from their loss or try to remember historical financial contracts?  Now the government has put a deadline for claiming.  Before that deadline banks should make every reasonable effort to trace those who have had PPI making it easier for them to pursue a claim.

attributes.action: Abolish school uniform in all schools.
attributes.background: School uniform rules have recently become too strict, to the point where people are being suspended from school for their appearance. We preach about not missing education yet we stop it over cloth and dye? Teenagers should express themselves and not be punished for being unique.
attributes.additional_details: When a student has done something particularly bad like get into a fight or bully another student we suspend them or put them in isolation to punish the student. Why is a student with blue hair or with a t-shirt being punished at the same level? We encourage students to 'be themselves' yet we confine this with rules. Teenagers already struggle in schools with exams, hormones, sexuality etc. We shouldn't be giving them more reasons to stress out. Casual dress-code doesn't stop them learning.

attributes.action: Ban exams, instead get graded for classwork.
attributes.background: Because many people have anxiety, and this would help them from getting through this. Usually children to much better in class than under exam conditions.

attributes.action: ban homework
attributes.background:
i don't like homework, students don't like homework, teachers don't like homework, so why is homework a thing? we don't need it, so lets get rid of it!
it prevents social building of students, and increases the workload heavily on teachers. homework is bad for everyone, the recipient, and producer.
attributes.additional_details: i hate homework, so let's get rid of it

attributes.action: New independent complaints & monitoring body for schools & local authorities
attributes.background: Legislation and DfE guidance state how schools and local authorities must comply with the law. If statutory guidance or duties are not followed, enforcement is left to solo families using ineffective complaint procedures, or the LGO service, which won’t act in the face of ultra vires local policies.
attributes.additional_details: This problem often relates to SEN support, mental or physical illness provision, bullying, or disability discrimination. The lack of accountability in the system creates severe difficulties for families & denies many children the support & education they need. ‘Not Fine in School’ call for a new independent, transparent & objective body to enable a fair complaints process, which is NOT investigated by the complained of services. This body must be empowered to monitor practices & instigate consequences when schools or local authorities use local (invalid) policies, or act in an ultra vires way.

attributes.action: State categorically that Canada has our support in its spat with Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain is leaving the EU and restrengthening our links with our Commonwealth friends, why have we turned our back on Canada during their assault by Saudi Arabia? We share a monarchy and history, so an attack on Canada is also an attack on us and our way of life.
attributes.additional_details: We should back Canada fully against Saudi Arabia and show them that they are not alone in standing up for human rights in the world. Cowardice and arms sales should never come before long term friends and relations. Many of us have family members in Canada and our history goes back all the way. How embarrassing that our government has put money before pride, morality and friends.

attributes.action: After Brexit - Expats spouses should be allowed to live in the UK without a visa
attributes.background: After the Brexit, British expats should be able to bring our partners/wifes/husbands who are not British to live in the UK without a visa (as in the past being in Europe).
attributes.additional_details: With the current deal for Brexit, if you want to move back, we can get passports for our children but not our wifes or husbands. Our wifes and husbands should be given freedom of movement as our children do. We are families, we shouldn’t be split apart.

attributes.action: To keep the RAF Red Arrows in Lincolnshire after RAF Scampton closes.
attributes.background: The Red Arrows have been in lincoln for years . It's there home and alot of people would agree they should stay in lincoln as that is one of the know facts of lincoln .

attributes.action: Bring back our job center to Darwen
attributes.background: Bring back our job center to Darwen which closed early this year without even asking the people of darwen if this was ok
attributes.additional_details:
UNEMPLOYED people in parts of East Lancashire will face extra 10 mile round-trips after the Department of Work and Pensions announced it will merge two jobcentres with nearby sites.

As a result of an estates review by the DWP, jobcentres in Green Street, Darwen, and Market Street, Colne, will now be axed.

attributes.action: Make employers offer part-time working for new parents
attributes.background: Lots of parents who worked full time before having children are unable to do so once the child is born. At present employers are allowed to consider part-time options but they do not have to honour them leaving new mums and dads no option but to resign. The same job level should also be available.
attributes.additional_details: Returning to a role after having a baby is difficult enough, it seems that if you want part-time you have to fight for it and if it is granted the job level you were at before is not always made available to you. I believe that it should be compulsory to offer a part time role at the same level. Parents should not be penalised in the workplace for having a child.

attributes.action: Add teaching of CPR and basic lifesaving skills to the teaching syllabus
attributes.background: Many lives could potentially be saved if more individuals within the U.K. knew how to correctly carry out CPR and had the knowledge of basic lifesaving skills. Include these topics in the primary & secondary national curriculum to save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Male & Female employees should be treated the same when on shared parental leave
attributes.background:
Because of the Equality Act 2010 woman and men should have the same company benefits as equal pay.
At the moment companies can offer a enhanced maternity pay that benefits only women can opt not to offer the same benefits to male employees wanting to take Shared Paternal Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment there isn't any legal requirement, with some cases people making a claim that they are being treated less favourable than women on the same company and/or job, some being successful and some not.
Some companies use the technicality that male employee on shared parental leave is treated no less favourably than a female employee on shared parental leave while they offer enhaced maternity pay a benefit only available to womans.

attributes.action: Make Battle of Britain Day, the 15th of September, a public holiday.
attributes.background: Let the 15th of September as "Battle of Britain Day" be made a public holiday to celebrate that one day in the field of human conflict that represents that grand singularity of the unity of purpose of the diverse peoples of this great nation that says 'together we are'.
attributes.additional_details:
The Battle of Britain, as fought between the 10th of July and the 31st of October, 1940, was summed up by Winston Churchill with the words "Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few". 

On the 15th of September, 1940, the Luftwaffe embarked on its largest bombing attack yet, which required the engagement of the entirety of the RAF in defence of London and the South East, resulting in a decisive British victory that marked the turning point in Britain's favour.
